1.text: If I speak with the tongues of men and angels, but do not have love, I have become a noisy gong or a clanging cymbal.

2.text: If I have the gift of prophecy and know all mysteries and have all knowledge, and if I have all faith, so as to move mountains, but I do not have love, I am nothing.

3.text: If I give out all my goods to feed the poor, and give my body so that I will burn but do not have love, it profits me nothing.

4.text: Love is patient and is kind; love does not envy. Love does not brag, it is not proud,

5.text: it does not behave inappropriately, it is not self-oriented. [Love] does not take offence and does not keep track of evil,

6.text: it does not rejoice in unrighteousness, but rejoices with the truth.

7.text: [Love] bears all things, believes all things, hopes all things, endures all things.

8.text: Love never fails. But as for prophecies, they will come to an end; as for tongues, they will cease; as for knowledge, it will pass away.

9.text: We know [only] in part, and we prophesy [only] in part;

10.text: but when that which is complete comes, then that which is incomplete will be done away with.

11.text: When I was a child, I spoke as a child, I felt as a child, I thought as a child. Now that I have become full-grown, I have put away childish things.

12.text: Now indeed, we see in a mirror, dimly, but then we shall see face to face. Now I know [only] in part, but then, I will know fully, even as I have been fully known.

13.text: But now, faith, hope, and love remain: these three, and the greatest of these is love.
